info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 28 at 2:57PM MDT until September 28 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...Portions of central and southeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Eastern Lincoln County. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves County Plains and Southwest Chaves County.
* WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The ground is already saturated across portions of eastern Lincoln County and Chaves County that received from a half inch to nearly 2 inches of rain Saturday night into this morning. High resolution models depict additional thunderstorms developing over the area late this afternoon and early evening. A few of the stronger storms will be capable of producing rain at rates near 1 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
